greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = if n<6 then n else 6*a(floor(n/6)) + 5 - n mod 6.
comment: Self-inverse permutation of the natural numbers;
if n is written in base 6 representation, then a(n) is the value after replacing all digits d (but not the leading one) by 5-d.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 20 2006
